title: Tesla Supplier STMicroelectronics Expects Lower Sales as Chip Industry Woes Persist
text: STMicroelectronics forecasted lower sales this quarter as weak demand for some semiconductors used in cars and industrial equipment continues to plague an industry that now faces heightened uncertainty from President Trump's unpredictable tariff policies.

title: Tesla Sales Slumped Again in EU Last Month
text: Sales plunged for the third consecutive month, a setback for Elon Musk's EV maker even as demand for battery-electric vehicles grew in the bloc.

title: Tesla Eyes June Launch for Robotaxis Amid Decline in Sales
text: Automotive manufacturer Tesla is reportedly rolling out trials of its ridesharing service, giving employees access, as it looks to expand that service later this year. In a Wednesday (April 23) post on X, Tesla shared a video of passengers hailing and riding in one of its vehicles, as a driver sat in the front.

title: Tesla's Energy Division Shines, But ETF Risks Mount Amid Broader Challenges
text: Tesla Inc  TSLA is still one of Wall Street's most-watched names, but now it's less about innovation and more about crash landings — figuratively speaking.

title: SpaceX vs. Tesla: Expert reveals which Elon Musk company will win
text: EntrepreneurShares COO Eva Ados weighs the benefits of owning SpaceX compared to Tesla on 'Making Money.' #foxbusiness #makingmoney

title: Tesla begins ‘FSD Supervised' ride-hail tests with employees in Austin, Bay Area
text: Tesla has started testing its autonomous ride-hail service with employees in Austin and the Bay Area ahead of the company's planned robotaxi launch this summer.

title: Tesla Takedown Says Protests Are Working: Hitting Where It Hurts, 'The Company's Bottom Line'
text: The involvement of Tesla Inc.  TSLA CEO Elon Musk in politics may have hurt demand for the company's vehicles, leading to lower first-quarter financial results.

title: Options Corner: AAPL, TSLA, MMM
text: Tom White turns to unusual options activity he found in tech companies that recently reported or will report earnings within the next week. He turns to a pair of Mag 7 stocks in Apple (AAPL) and Tesla (TSLA).

title: Tesla's Miss 'Wasn't That Big': Truist's Stein
text: William Stein, Truist Securities semiconductor & AI equity research analyst, says there were positive signs in Tesla's earnings, despite a larger than expected miss. Stein joins Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on “Bloomberg Technology”.

title: Tesla Retail Investor Shrugs Off Impact of Brand Damage
text: Alexandra Merz, CEO of L&F Investor Services and a prominent Tesla shareholder, says she is happy with Elon Musk's work at the Department of Government Efficiency and believes the company has an edge in full self-driving. Merz, who goes by @TeslaBoomerMama on X, joins Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on “Bloomberg Technology.

title: Tesla CEO Musk says time he spends on DOGE will drop 'significantly' next month
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk began his company's earnings call on Tuesday by saying that his time spent running President Donald Trump's so-called Department of Government Efficiency will drop "significantly" starting in May.

title: Musk drops bombshell on his involvement with DOGE
text: ‘The Big Money Show' panelists react to Elon Musk's recent announcement regarding his involvement in the Department of Government Efficiency.

title: Elon Musks wants '10 million' autonomous Teslas
text: CNBC's Dierdre Bosa reports on news regarding Tesla.

title: Tesla's earnings miss was viewed reasonably constructively, says BofA's John Murphy
text: John Murphy, BofA Securities senior auto analyst, joins 'The Exchange' to discuss why Tesla still faces a lot of hurdles, the company's quarterly earnings results.

title: Tesla Stock Boosts EV Sector After Earnings
text: Shares of Tesla Inc (NASDAQ:TSLA) were last seen up 7.7% at $256.34 today, despite the company's major profit loss in the first quarter.

title: Tesla earnings tanked as Elon Musk ran DOGE
text: Tesla saw revenue drop 20% in Q1. Transcript: Tesla revealed its latest earnings report and it was a really rough first quarter for the EV maker.

title: Anti-Musk protests are now an official risk to Tesla's business
text: Protests against Elon Musk and Tesla have been spreading around the world thanks to the CEO's involvement in the Trump administration. Now those protests are listed in an official “risk factor” in paperwork Tesla is required to file with federal regulators.

title: Tesla exec cancels Rome conference trip over security concerns
text: A Tesla senior executive has cancelled her attendance at a conference in Rome over fears of protests surrounding the carmaker in response to CEO Elon Musk's right-wing activism.

title: Tesla Stock Faces Demand, Political, Tariff Pressure: Why Analysts Focus On 'Multiple Generational Growth Drivers'
text: Tesla Inc TSLA analysts are cautious on the short-term outlook of the electric vehicle company after it missed revenue and earnings per share estimates in the first quarter.

title: Tesla Stock Is Jumping Today. Is the Stock a Buy Now That Elon Musk Plans to Step Back From DOGE?
text: Tesla (TSLA 5.93%) stock is seeing big gains in Wednesday's trading despite publishing disappointing earnings results yesterday after market close. The company's share price was up 7.2% as of 11:30 a.m.

title: Tesla bull vs. bear case, Boeing earnings
text: Morning Brief hosts Madison Mills and Brad Smith take a look at the market movement and top stories on April 23, 2025. Barclays senior autos analyst Dan Levy and Stifel NextGen Transport analyst Stephen Gengaro join the show to discuss Tesla's first quarter results and share their bull and bear cases for the stock.

title: Top Stock Movers Now: Tesla, Boeing, Enphase, and More
text: U.S. stock indexes rallied at midday Wednesday as President Donald Trump said he has "no intention" of firing Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell and made further comments suggesting a de-escalation of the trade war with China.

title: Markets Await New Home Sales Data
text: Pre-market futures remain up big after a welcome surge in Tuesday trading. Yesterday's session saw major indexes grow +2.5% or more, making up most of the losses that took down the stock market Monday.

title: Tesla vs. Waymo: Musk casts doubt on Google's robotaxi strategy
text: CNBC's Deirdre Bosa reports on news regarding Tesla and Google.

text: Not many people expected an earnings beat from Tesla's (TSLA 6.66%) first-quarter report last night. The results were even worse than anticipated in many respects.

title: Tesla: The Bottom May Be In
text: Tesla: The Bottom May Be In

title: Tesla Stock Jumps 8% Despite Terrible Results
text: Tesla (TSLA 7.40%) stock has climbed 8% after reporting what can only be described as a terrible first quarter of 2025. The company's sales dropped, and it was profitable only because of regulatory credit sales.

title: What Elon Musk Said About Tesla's Timelines for Robots, Autonomous Rides and More
text: Investors interested in what Elon Musk says is ahead for Tesla (TSLA), rather than the company's latest numbers, got some fresh information from the electric vehicle maker's CEO yesterday.

title: Should You Buy Tesla ETFs Post Q1 Earnings Miss?
text: Tesla TSLA reported dismal first-quarter 2025 results, missing estimates for earnings and revenues. However, shares of Tesla jumped more than 5% in after-market hours after CEO Elon Musk injected optimism by reaffirming the company's goals for the launch of robotaxis and affordable vehicles.

title: Tesla's moves toward lower-cost cars & energy are underestimated, says William Blair's Dorsheimer
text: Jed Dorsheimer, William Blair analyst, joins CNBC's 'Squawk on the Street' to discuss reactions to Tesla's earnings, how Elon Musk's return to the company will impact the business, and more.

title: Tesla CEO Musk warns China rare earth restrictions may delay Optimus robot rollout
text: Tesla Inc (NASDAQ:TSLA)'s Optimus humanoid robot project could be delayed by restrictions on the export of rare earth minerals from China, CEO Elon Musk told investors during the company's first quarter earnings call on Tuesday. Musk described the situation as a “magnet issue.

title: Tesla stock: A bull and a bear make their cases
text: Despite Tesla's (TSLA) first quarter earnings missing estimates on the top and bottom lines, Barclays senior autos analyst Dan Levy says the results were "net positive" for the stock. Levy joins Morning Brief with Madison Mills and Brad Smith to explain how he's weighing the potential of the Tesla narrative with the company's weak fundamentals, comparing sentiment around the stock to that of bitcoin (BTC-USD).

title: More Empty Promises To Sell: Tesla's Problem Isn't Musk In DOGE
text: Tesla, Inc. printed horrible Q1 numbers after the bell yesterday but the stock is up +5% on Musk reducing time at DOGE. We think it's up for the wrong reasons. Tesla's problem isn't Musk being distracted, it is heavy Chinese competition causing pricing pressure in the world outside America and softer demand in U.S. Tesla stock doesn't always trade on fundamentals, but fundamentals aren't escapable forever, and even with Musk, Tesla won't be immune.

title: Why Tesla's Robotaxi launch is the one deadline it can't miss
text: Tesla's Robotaxi launch is set for June. A successful launch is key to the company's future and investors' confidence in the company.

title: 5 quotes: Elon Musk on robotaxi timeline, Optimus robots, tariffs, energy and Tesla's future
text: Elon Musk gave Tesla bulls plenty to believe in during Tesla's earnings call. Musk said he would reduce his efforts at DOGE and focus more on Tesla starting in May, but would "continue to spend a day or two per week on government matters.

title: Tesla reports enough cash to fund products on agenda, including new lower priced model
text: CNBC's Phil LeBeau joins 'Squawk on the Street' to discuss Tesla's latest earnings report.

title: Dow Jumps Over 1,000 Points; Tesla Shares Rise After Q1 Results
text: U.S. stocks traded higher this morning, with the Dow Jones index gaining more than 1,000 points on Wednesday.

title: Tesla stock pops after Trump comments on China tariffs and Powell, despite weak earnings
text: Tesla shares rallied despite missing top and bottom line estimates and reporting a 20% year-over-year drop in automotive revenue and a 71% decline in net income. Musk said he will spend "significantly" less time at The Department of Government Efficiency starting next month.

title: Attorney Amy Witherite Says: Billions at Stake as Tesla and Aurora Innovations Bank on Driverless Technology
text: DALLAS--(BUSINESS WIRE)--Attorney and traffic safety expert Amy Witherite says billions of dollars are at stake as autonomous trucks begin operating on the nation's highways in 2025. Aurora Robotics has announced plans to begin removing drivers from trucks operating on routes between Dallas—Houston and Fort Worth—El Paso. This move comes as the company prepares to go public through a merger with a special-purpose acquisition company. Published reports estimate the deal values Kodiak at approxim.

title: Elon Musk Gets $10 Billion Richer As Tesla Stock Rallies On ‘Mea Culpa' —Despite Brutal Earnings
text: The world's richest person got much richer Wednesday as shares of Elon Musk's car company Tesla soared following the company's first-quarter earnings update—which offered little encouragement in its traditional financial results, but gave investors what they long yearned for: Musk recommitting to Tesla after months of paying his near undivided attention to the White House.

title: TSLA Rallies on Musk Easing DOGE Role, AAPL & META Fined by EU
text: Even though its first quarter earnings showed a lack of traction, Tesla (TSLA) still drove higher after Elon Musk said his time allocation to DOGE will "drop significantly." Jenny Horne takes a closer look at the earnings and explains Elon's path ahead to turn Tesla around.

title: Tesla Q1: It's Not As Bad As I Thought (Rating Downgrade)
text: Tesla, Inc.'s stock has experienced a significant decline, dropping 57% from its peak due to market selloff and operational challenges. Despite a poor quarter, Tesla remains fundamentally strong with a solid support level, improving technical indicators, and positive long-term catalysts like FSD and robotaxi developments. Tesla's financials show resilience with a GAAP net income of $409 million and $664 million in free cash flow, despite lower automotive revenues.

title: S&P500: Tesla, Boeing Jump as Traders React to Powell Stability and Tariff Easin
text: US indices rise pre-market as traders welcome Powell's Fed support, softening tariffs, and gains in Tesla, Boeing, and Nvidia. Read the full market outlook.

title: Tesla Earnings: This Is Not Investing, It's A Wall Street Circus
text: Tesla, Inc. is a casino in the form of a stock. And while I am happy to try my luck, I'm not going to be more than a trader in it. This article reviews my attempt to collar the stock after my last article on TSLA, as well as an earnings preview. Treating this stock like it is just another business trading on the stock exchange and making widgets is just silly. I explain my rationale.

title: TSLA Q1 Earnings Miss Mark, Investors Pin Hopes on Robotaxi, Cheap EVs
text: Despite a weak first quarter, Tesla shares rise in after-hour trading on Musk's vision for budget EVs, robotaxi trials and Cybercab rollout.

title: Tesla and China: EV maker is facing competition like never before, analyst says
text: Tesla (TSLA) is facing growing pressure in China after a weak first quarter. The company says it will revisit its 2025 guidance in the next update.

title: BA in Crosshairs of U.S. and China Trade; TSLA "Hard to Disentangle" from Musk
text: Dave Mazza looks at Boeing (BA) after better-than-expected earnings, but the outlook "is really so hard to forecast" in light of ongoing trade tensions with China. While Dave still thinks the investment community is skeptical on BA, he does call the aerospace giant a potential turnaround story.

title: Tesla Earnings Miss, But Musk Refocuses And Bulls React
text: Tesla Inc. NASDAQ: TSLA closed under $238 on Tuesday after gaining 5% ahead of its Q1 earnings report. When results dropped after the bell, the company missed both revenue and earnings expectations, but the market response has been surprisingly constructive.

title: Nasdaq in the driving seat as Wall Street futures point to extended gains, Tesla up premarket
text: US stock futures were sharply higher ahead of Wednesday's opening bell, building on a powerful rebound the day before as markets respond positively to a marked shift in tone from the Trump administration on trade. Dow Jones futures were pointing to a gain of 623 points or 1.58% ahead of the open, while S&P 500 futures were up 2.29%, while the Nasdaq was leading with a 2.69% jump.

title: Tesla earnings lay bare a tough quarter – but UK investors get the Musk moment they were hoping for
text: By any measure, Tesla Inc's (NASDAQ:TSLA) latest quarterly results were bleak. A steep drop in revenue, plunging profits and no firm growth guidance for the year left investors bracing for impact.

title: Bousta: Elon focusing on Tesla is great news, but the challenge is huge

title: Wall Street Breakfast Podast: Trump Won't Oust Powell, Musk Can't Quit Tesla
text: President Trump's assertion he won't fire Fed Chairman Powell eased market concerns, boosting growth stocks and lifting Nasdaq and S&P futures. Despite Trump's comments, concerns about Fed independence persist, with economists warning of potential long-term damage to the central bank's credibility.

title: Tesla Stock Investors Just Got Good News From CEO Elon Musk, but Q1 Earnings Were a Disaster
text: Tesla (TSLA 4.71%) stock has declined 41% year to date, making it one of the 10 worst-performing companies in the S&P 500. Shares initially soared when Donald Trump won the presidential election in November.
